duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead all aspects of safety culture and injury-free environment commitment, mentor others on safety awareness, and manage subcontractors and workflow.
Provide management and oversight of staff, subcontractors, suppliers, safety, quality, and EEOC for projects.
Develop work plans for subcontractors, coordinate and manage the project site, lead various meetings, and attend project meetings.
Create, manage, and implement project schedules, monitor project budget, and communicate project information to stakeholders.
Support project closeouts, collaboration with the project team, establish field staffing, and participate in negotiation processes.
Identify and recruit top talent, promote diversity and inclusion, and implement non-discrimination policies.
Manage the largest and most complex stand-alone projects, provide oversight to multiple projects, and lead strategic initiatives.
Deliver leadership messages, present training content, and build relationships internally and externally.
Apply construction management fundamentals, project processes, lean process and philosophy, and specific trades and scopes of work knowledge.
Manage budgets, maximize profitability, build relationships, and collaborate within a team.
Understand and apply document changes, layout skill, crane flagging and rigging, productivity rates, and cost management skills.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in construction management, engineering, or related field (Preferred). In lieu of the above requirements, equivalent relevant experience will be considered.
